column4: could someone PLEASE help me with this? http://paste.ubuntu.com/101589/
could anyone PLEASE help me with this? http://paste.ubuntu.com/101589/
disk-1 is what a USB thumb drive?
try the command mount and see what it actually is you'll have a line like: /dev/sdb1 on /media/disk-1 type ext3 (rw,nosuid,nodev,uhelper=hal)
run "sudo mount", you'll get a list of all mounted file systems, one of them will say something like /dev/sdb1 on /media/disk-1, you need to know what the /dev/sd*# part is
never mind just thought, are you trying to clear the contents of the USB drive?
note, it could take a very long time based on how fast your computer is and how much data there is to delete
try using sudo with both commands
but i know of another way
I use it all the time, I'm a bit confused as the problem going on here
